intro: Clompanus dongnaiensis, commonly known as the Dong Nai mountain bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Vietnam. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, blue to violet flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments within its native habitat. Its leaves are oval-shaped with a smooth surface and dark green color. Clompanus dongnaiensis is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and limited distribution.
